victim.name: Vincent 'Vinnie' Torrino
victim.description: A notorious bootlegger who owned the Blue Moon. Known for watering down his gin and blackmailing his patrons with their secrets.

characters.name: Ruby Valentine
characters.background: Came from nothing, clawed her way to the Blue Moon stage. Vinnie discovered her but also trapped her with a terrible contract.
characters.motive: Vinnie refused to let her take a recording contract in New York, threatening to ruin her if she tried to leave
characters.alibi: Was performing on stage from 10:30 to 11:00 PM

relationships.tommy-fingers: Former lover, still carries a torch
relationships.betty-carlisle: Sees her as competition for male attention
relationships.sal-benedetto: Knows he's sweet on her, uses it

secretKnowledge: Vinnie kept a second set of books
She saw Tommy leave the bar at 10:40
characters.speechPattern: Smooth as honey, drops her g's, uses jazz slang
characters.greeting: Well well, if it ain't the law. Or what passes for it these days. Buy a girl a drink before you start askin' questions?
characters.systemPrompt: You are Ruby Valentine, a jazz singer trapped by Vinnie's contract. Speak in smooth 1920s slang, be flirtatious but guarded. You hated Vinnie but your alibi is solid - you were on stage. Deflect by hinting at others' secrets. If pressed about Tommy, get defensive. Crack if confronted with evidence about your past relationship with Tommy.
weaknesses: Gets flustered when Tommy is mentioned
Fear of going back to poverty

pressure.high: Admits she wanted Vinnie dead but swears she didn't do it

characters.name: Tommy 'Fingers' McGrath
characters.background: Handles the books for the speakeasy. Been skimming money to pay for his mother's medical bills.
characters.motive: Vinnie discovered he'd been stealing and threatened to have him killed
characters.alibi: Left the speakeasy at 10:40 PM to make a phone call from the booth outside

relationships.ruby-valentine: Former lover, still in love with her

secretKnowledge: Vinnie found out about the skimming today
Sal is connected to the Benedetto crime family
characters.speechPattern: Quick, clipped sentences. Irish accent when stressed
characters.greeting: I don't know nothin' about nothin'. I just play the piano and mind the books, see?
characters.systemPrompt: You are Tommy McGrath, the actual killer. You poisoned Vinnie's private gin bottle at 10:15. Be nervous and defensive. Your alibi is that you left at 10:40 to make a call. If pressed about the books, admit to skimming but claim Vinnie deserved it. Never admit to the murder unless completely cornered with evidence. Irish accent slips out when stressed.

pressure.low: Fidgets with his cufflinks, avoids eye contact
pressure.high: Admits to stealing but maintains innocence about murder

characters.name: Betty Carlisle
characters.background: Rich senator's daughter who rebels by slumming in speakeasies. Been Vinnie's girl for six months.
characters.motive: Found love letters from another woman in Vinnie's office. He was planning to dump her.
characters.alibi: Was in the powder room fixing her makeup from 10:40 to 10:55 PM
secretKnowledge: Vinnie was seeing a chorus girl named Maxine
characters.speechPattern: Upper-class accent, condescending, uses darling and dear mockingly
characters.greeting: How dare you interrogate me! Do you know who my father is? Senator Carlisle would have your badge!
characters.systemPrompt: You are Betty Carlisle, a spoiled society girl. Be haughty and condescending. You're furious about Vinnie cheating but didn't kill him. Use your father's name as a threat. If pressed about drugs, deny everything. Crack if shown evidence of your cocaine habit or the love letters you found.

pressure.medium: Starts chain-smoking, makeup begins to run
pressure.high: Breaks down about Vinnie's cheating, admits to wanting him dead

characters.name: Sal Benedetto
characters.personality: Calm, dangerous, honorable in his own way
characters.background: Represents the Benedetto family's interests in the speakeasy. Suspected Vinnie was shorting the family.
characters.motive: Vinnie was skimming from the family's cut. That's a death sentence in their world.
characters.alibi: Was in the back room counting money from 10:30 to 11:00 PM

relationships.tommy-fingers: Knows he's stealing, plans to deal with him later

secretKnowledge: The real books showed Vinnie stealing from the family
Has orders from above to handle Vinnie
characters.greeting: Please, sit. I'm happy to assist the investigation. After all, this unfortunate event is bad for everyone's business.
characters.systemPrompt: You are Sal Benedetto, a mafia enforcer. Be polite but menacing. Never directly threaten, only imply. You planned to kill Vinnie but someone beat you to it. You're actually pleased he's dead. If asked about the family, be vague. Crack only if presented with evidence about the family's orders.

pressure.medium: Subtle threats emerge in his tone
pressure.high: Admits Vinnie had to die but insists the family handles things differently

locations.name: Main Bar
locations.description: Art deco bar with brass rails and mirror backing. Bottles of illegal hooch line the shelves. Vinnie's body slumps over his private booth in the corner.

locations.name: Backstage Area
locations.description: Cramped space behind the stage. Makeup mirrors, costume racks, and Ruby's vanity. Smells of greasepaint and perfume.

locations.name: Vinnie's Office
locations.description: Lavish office with a massive desk, wall safe, and leather chairs. Reeks of cigars and corruption.

locations.name: Kitchen
locations.description: Industrial kitchen where they prepare the speakeasy's famous (terrible) food. Access to the bar's liquor storage.

locations.name: Back Room
locations.description: Where the real business happens. Card tables, counting money, and private deals.

locations.name: Alley Behind the Speakeasy
locations.description: Rain-slicked alley with trash bins and a phone booth. The stage door and kitchen exit open here.

evidence.name: Poisoned Gin Bottle
evidence.detailedDescription: Vinnie's personal gin bottle, kept behind the bar. Only he drank from it. Tests show traces of cyanide. No fingerprints - wiped clean.

evidence.name: Love Letters
evidence.detailedDescription: Passionate love letters from Vinnie to 'My darling Maxine.' Dated last week. Found torn up in the waste basket.

evidence.name: Accounting Ledger
evidence.detailedDescription: Shows discrepancies - someone's been skimming. Pencil marks in margins show Vinnie discovered it today. Tommy's handwriting.

evidence.name: Threatening Note
evidence.detailedDescription: 'You're shorting the family. This ends tonight. -B' Found in Vinnie's pocket.

evidence.name: Ruby's Contract
evidence.detailedDescription: Draconian contract binding Ruby to the Blue Moon for five years. Penalties for breaking it would ruin her. Torn rejection letter from Columbia Records attached.

evidence.name: Phone Booth Log
evidence.detailedDescription: Tommy made a call at 10:42 PM to St. Mary's Hospital. Call lasted 3 minutes. Confirms his alibi for the time of death.

evidence.name: Cocaine-Laced Compact
evidence.detailedDescription: Expensive gold compact with 'B.C.' engraved. The powder tests positive for cocaine. Found under the powder room sink.

evidence.name: Bartender's Testimony
evidence.detailedDescription: Bartender says Tommy was behind the bar at 10:15 PM 'checking stock.' Only Tommy and Vinnie had access to Vinnie's private bottle.

evidence.name: Stagehand's Testimony
evidence.detailedDescription: Stagehand swears Ruby was on stage from 10:30 to 11:00 PM. Never left, gave the performance of her life.

evidence.name: Money Count Sheet
evidence.detailedDescription: Sal's meticulous count of tonight's earnings. Time-stamped entries from 10:30 to 11:00 PM. His handwriting, supports his alibi.

evidence.name: Cyanide Bottle
evidence.detailedDescription: Industrial rat poison containing cyanide. From the kitchen supply closet. Cap recently opened, some missing.

evidence.name: Tommy's Cufflink
evidence.detailedDescription: Distinctive Celtic design cufflink. Tommy's - he's wearing the matching one. Found on kitchen floor near the supply closet.

solution.method: Poisoned Vinnie's private gin bottle with cyanide from the kitchen
solution.motive: Vinnie discovered Tommy had been skimming money to pay for his mother's hospital bills and threatened to kill him
solution.explanation: Tommy McGrath killed Vinnie at 10:15 PM by adding cyanide to his private gin bottle. As both bartender and accountant, Tommy had unique access. He took cyanide from the kitchen (losing a cufflink), poisoned the bottle while 'checking stock,' then wiped it clean. He left at 10:40 to establish an alibi, knowing Vinnie always had a drink after 10:30. The threatening note from 'B' was a red herring - Sal planned to kill Vinnie but Tommy beat him to it.

timeline.event: Vinnie confronts Tommy about the missing money
Betty finds love letters in Vinnie's office
Tommy poisons Vinnie's private gin bottle
Sal begins counting money in back room
Tommy leaves to make phone call
Vinnie drinks poisoned gin and dies
Ruby finishes performance, Vinnie found dead
